title: UK Space Industry Sees Annual Expansion
summary: According to a report by the UK Space Agency (UKSA), the UK space industry saw a real-term income growth of 5.1%, amounting to £17.5 billion...

title: ESA Launches Europe's First Mission to Jupiter
summary: The ESA Jupiter Icy Moons Explorer (JUICE) mission is now on its way to Jupiter after its successful launch onboard an Ariane 5 rocket from Europe's Spaceport in French Guiana, this 5,963kg satellite is tasked with exploring the gas giant Jupiter and its Icey moons. The mission is expected to take around 8 years to get to Jupiter.

title: SpaceLogistics to service Intelsat satellite after Optus life-extending mission
summary: Intelsat has ordered one of three fuel pods Northrop Grumman’s in-orbit servicing subsidiary is launching in late 2024 to extend the life of one of its geostationary satellites by at least six years, the operator announced April 13.

title: In Navy experiment, commercial satellites serve as key weapons against drug traffickers
summary: In an experiment last fall near Virginia's coast, a team of engineers used commercial hardware, software and satellite data to show the U.S. Navy how it could quickly turn information from satellites into useful intelligence.

title: First ispace mission ready for lunar landing as company stock starts trading
summary: As Japanese company ispace prepares to land on the moon for the first time, its stock is taking off on a Japanese exchange.

title: SpaceX Transporter-7 scrubs launch of 51 payloads, booster return to LZ
summary: SpaceX scrubbed a scheduled launch of the Transporter-7 rideshare mission from Space Launch Complex 4E (SLC-4E) at Vandenberg Space Force Base due to weather constraints. The mission will try again on Friday, April 14, 2023, at 11:47 PM PDT (06:47 UTC on April 15).
